ai-cp16:1.1_0: “May the Brahmā realm be fully understood
ai-cp16:1.3_0: A trapper is called a lion,
ai-cp16:2.1_0: In the jungle, the lovely grove
ai-cp16:2.4_0: who dwells in the Ganges river.
ai-cp16:3.3_0: A man falls into the Ganges River
ai-cp16:4.2_0: being swept away by the great hermit.
ai-cp16:4.4_0: you go to the middle of the Ganges.
ai-cp16:5.3_0: Having set on the Ganges river,
ai-cp16:6.1_0: And when I asked me about this,
ai-cp16:6.4_0: now I left the great storm!’
ai-cp16:7.2_0: and my life is running out;
ai-cp16:7.4_0: in the dark of the night.
ai-cp16:8.4_0: don’t flee me down by anyone.”
ai-cp16:9.1_0: When you’ve gone to the city,
ai-cp16:10.3_0: When the king heard his words,
ai-cp16:12.1_0: I look after my ethical conduct,
ai-cp16:12.4_0: She’s been defeated by the Bodhi.
ai-cp16:13.1_0: enemies of King, wealth, and authority.
